text: Musa (lit. "Warrior"), released as both "The Warrior" and "The Ultimate Warrior" in English-speaking countries, is a 2001 South Korean epic action drama film directed by Kim Sung-su, starring Jung Woo-sung, Ahn Sung-ki, Joo Jin-mo and Chinese actress Zhang Ziyi.

title: Musa (film)
text: The semi-historical story follows the adventures of a Korean peace delegation as they try to get back to Korea through the inhospitable deserts of northern China.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The Kerman Seljuk Sultanate( also known as Kerman sultanate Persian: سلجوقیان کرمان Saljūqiyān- i Kerman) was a Turko- Persian Sunni Muslim state, established in the parts of Kerman and Makran which had been conquered from the Buyid dynasty by the Seljuk Empire which was established by Seljuk Turks.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The Founder of this dynasty, Emadeddin Kara Arslan Ahmad Qavurt who succeeded the ruler of this dynasty after the surrender of the ruler of Buyyids, Abu Kalijar Marzuban.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: For first time in this period, an independent state was formed in Kerman; eventually, after 150 years, with the invasion of the Ghuz leader's Malik Dinar, the Kerman Seljuk Sultanate fall.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: The government is the first powerful local government in the Kerman and Makran region, which, in addition to political and security stability, could create economic prosperity in the provinces.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: It was during this period that the Spice Road burgeoned with the flourishing of the ports of Tiz, Hormuz and Kish, and this state, as the highway of this important economic road, could use tremendous wealth with the conditions it had created.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: Regarding the scientific and social conditions, at this time, with the efforts of the Shahs such as Mohammad Shah II, the scientific and cultural centers were established in Kerman, and with these actions, Kerman, which was away from the main scientific centers, became the center of science in the southeastern region of Iran's plateau.

title: Kerman Seljuk Sultanate
text: In addition, Kerman and Makran under ruling of Seljuk, grew in agriculture and Animal husbandry, and Progressed in Commerce and trade which led to improved economic and social conditions.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Lake Charles, Louisiana was named for Charles Sallier, an early settler of the area. Martin and Dela LeBleu were among the first to settle near Lake Charles, in the area called LeBleu Settlement.

text: They arrived in Lake Charles in 1781 from Bordeaux, France, and settled approximately six miles east of present- day Lake Charles, Louisiana.

title: Charles Sallier
text: In rage, he shot at his wife and assumed she was dead. In guilt and regret, Charles ran off. However, Catherine had survived the shot by only a simple piece of jewelry – her brooch.

title: Charles Sallier
text: She continued her life raising the six children in Lake Charles.

title: Charles Sallier
text: Soon after, Lake Charles residents began calling the area" Charlie's Lake," and by the late 19th century, the area where Charles Sallier once lived was called" Charleston," or" Charles Town.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow (Cailin Deas Crúite na mBó in the Irish language) is a traditional 18th-century Irish ballad.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The English version is attributed to Thomas Moore (1779–1852). Originally sung in Irish Gaelic, the song was popular through the early 20th century.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It enjoyed a revival when an updated swing version sung by Irish-American singer/actress Judy Garland was featured in the 1940 film Little Nellie Kelly.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The updated version is true to the original musical air, and incorporated original lyrics by MGM Musical Director Roger Edens, and featured Garland singing the song to George Murphy using some of the original Gaelic lyrics in the first chorus, which was true to the traditional air, before moving into an up-tempo swing version typical of the era.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The song was released as the B-side of the more popular Garland song It's A Great Day for the Irish by Decca Records in 1940.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It became a popular song for Irish-Americans during St Patrick's Day celebrations.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: It remained a popular number for Garland throughout her career, and most notably she sang it live in its original Irish language version in July 1951 at her Theatre Royal concerts in Dublin, Ireland.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: A Dublin review stated: "Remember the song she sang in "Nellie KellyThe Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: " Judy is providing herself with the Irish version – "Cailin Deas Cruidte na mBo" while in Ireland".

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Later in 1951, she included the song in her first record-breaking appearance at New York's Palace Theatre, although this time reverting to the new version that combined both English- and Irish-language lyrics.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The song is also featured on Garland at the Grove on Capitol Records, recorded live in 1958 at the Coconut Grove in Hollywood.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Singers and groups including Bing Crosby, Ruby Murray, Eileen Barton, Carmel Quinn, Clannad, The Fureys, Blackthorn Ceilidh Band, Runa and The Chieftains, Altan among others, have recorded the song in either form or a combination of both.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: Duck Baker recorded a fingerstyle guitar arrangement. The song was sung by Jack Jones the teenage son of Anne Jones the publican of the Glenrowan Inn (Victoria, Australia) while it was under siege by the Kelly Gang.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: The siege was broken by the Victorian Police on the morning of Monday June 28, 1880. Jack Jones died of injuries sustained during the police assault on the hotel.

title: A Pretty Girl Milking Her Cow
text: This song was cover-versioned by Japanese singer Suzuki Tsunekichi (Japanese: 鈴木常吉) in the title of "Memories" (Japanese: 思ひで), which was adapted as the opening theme song of Japanese TV drama "Shinya Shokudō"(Japanese: 深夜食堂).

title: Judy Garland
text: Judy Garland (born Frances Ethel Gumm; June 10, 1922 – June 22, 1969) was an American actress, singer and dancer.

title: Judy Garland
text: During a career that spanned 45 years, she attained international stardom as an actress in both musical and dramatic roles, as a recording artist, and on the concert stage.

title: Judy Garland
text: Respected for her versatility, she received an Academy Juvenile Award, a Golden Globe Award, and a Special Tony Award.

title: Judy Garland
text: In 1962, Garland won the Grammy Award for Album of the Year for her 1961 double LP live recording "Judy at Carnegie Hall"—the first woman to win in this category.

title: Judy Garland
text: She is considered by many to be one of the greatest artists of the 20th Century. Garland began performing in vaudeville as a child with her two elder sisters and was later signed to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer as a teenager.

title: Judy Garland
text: She appeared in more than two dozen films for MGM, and is best remembered for her portrayal of Dorothy Gale in "The Wizard of Oz" (1939).

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland was a frequent on-screen partner of both Mickey Rooney and Gene Kelly and regularly collaborated with director and second husband Vincente Minnelli.

title: Judy Garland
text: Some of her film appearances during this period include roles in "Meet Me in St. Louis" (1944), "The Harvey Girls" (1946), "Easter Parade" (1948), and "Summer Stock" (1950).

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland was released from MGM in 1950, after 15 years with the studio, amid a series of personal struggles that prevented her from fulfilling the terms of her contract.

title: Judy Garland
text: Although her film career became intermittent thereafter, two of Garland's most critically acclaimed performances came late in her career: she received a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance in "A Star Is Born" (1954) and a nomination for Best Supporting Actress for her role in "Judgment at Nuremberg" (1961).

title: Judy Garland
text: She also made record-breaking concert appearances, released eight studio albums, and hosted her own Emmy-nominated television series, "The Judy Garland Show" (1963–1964).

title: Judy Garland
text: At age 39, Garland became the youngest and first female recipient of the Cecil B. DeMille Award for lifetime achievement in the film industry.

title: Judy Garland
text: In 1997, Garland was posthumously awarded a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award.

title: Judy Garland
text: Several of her recordings have been inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame, and in 1999, the American Film Institute placed her among the 10 greatest female stars of classic American cinema.

title: Judy Garland
text: Garland struggled in her personal life from an early age.

title: Judy Garland
text: The pressures of early stardom affected her physical and mental health from her teens onward; her self-image was influenced and constantly criticized by film executives who believed that she was physically unattractive.

title: Judy Garland
text: Those same executives manipulated her onscreen physical appearance.

title: Judy Garland
text: Throughout her adulthood she was plagued by alcohol and substance abuse, as well as financial instability; she often owed hundreds of thousands of dollars in back taxes.

title: Judy Garland
text: Her lifelong addiction to drugs, including alcohol, ultimately led to her death in London from an accidental barbiturate overdose at age 47.

title: Iva Stewart
text: Iva Stewart( 1914–1985) was an American model and film actress. She was Miss Maine, and competed in Miss America 1933.

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Vacation
text: Mr Moto Takes A Vacation( 1939) is a Norman Foster- directed entry in the Mr. Moto film series, with Lionel Atwill and Joseph Schildkraut and G. P. Huntley, as Archie Featherstone, in supporting roles.

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Vacation
text: This was the last Mr. Moto film that Peter Lorre appeared in.

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Vacation
text: The movie was the seventh filmed in the series. However it was not released until after" Mr. Moto in Danger Island", which was the last filmed out of eight Mr. Moto films from 20th Century Fox.

text: Mr. Moto ’s Last Warning is the sixth in a series of eight films starring Peter Lorre as Mr. Moto. The film is an original story featuring the character created by John P. Marquand.

text: As an actor he was a leading man in early talkies and also appeared in Welles ’ final film" The Other Side of the Wind".

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Chance

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Chance
text: Its release was delayed until after production of "Thank You, Mr. Moto" and "Mr Moto's Gamble".

title: Mr. Moto Takes a Chance
text: The film is based on the character of Mr. Moto created by John P. Marquand, and an original story by Norman Foster and Willis Cooper.

title: Thank You, Mr. Moto (film)
text: It was based on the novel of the same name by the detective's creator, John P. Marquand.

title: Thank You, Mr. Moto (film)
text: Mr. Moto battles murderous treasure hunters for priceless ancient scrolls which reveal the location of the long- lost tomb of Genghis Khan.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: Santa Cruz Muluá is a municipality in the Retalhuleu department of Guatemala.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: Its name comes from the ancient mayan word" Mulaja" which means" Land Between Rivers," because its between the Samalá River, the Rio Muluá and many other small rivers and streams.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: It is situated 180 km from Guatemala City. The administrative center is bounded by the Samalá River to the west, which serves as the border with San Sebastián.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: Santa Cruz Muluá borders on the north with San Martín Zapotitlán, with theme parks Xetulul and Xocomil.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: Also to the north lies San Felipe famous for its blood sausage(" moronga" locally), to the east and the south is San Andrés Villa Seca.

title: Santa Cruz Muluá
text: Santa Cruz Mulua municipality contains several villages: El Asintal( also Canton Asintal), Los Brillantes( also Finca Los Brilliantes), Boxoma further to the south and not often visited and, Lolita, which is the most distant and close the Pacific coast.

title: Salang River
text: The Salang is a 438 kilometre long river of Afghanistan, flowing through Parwan Province. It is a tributary of the Indus River and the Ghorband River and the Panjshir River and the Kabul River.

title: Samalá River
text: The Samalá is a river in southwestern Guatemala. Its sources are in the Sierra Madre, Valle De Écija range, in the departments of Quetzaltenango and Totonicapán.

title: Samalá River
text: From there it flows down, past the towns San Carlos Sija in the Valle De Écija, Quetzaltenango, San Cristóbal Totonicapán, Quetzaltenango, El Palmar and Zunil, through the coastal plains of Retalhuleu into the Pacific Ocean.

title: Samalá River
text: The Samalá river basin covers a territory of and has a population of around 400,000 people.

title: Samalá River
text: Its proximity to the active Santa Maria and Santiaguito volcano complex, with its recurring lava and lahars flows, leads to a heightened risk of serious flooding.

title: Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre
text: Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre is a performing arts venue located in the Cumberland/ Galleria edge city, in northwest Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre
text: The$ 145 million facility celebrated its grand opening September 15, 2007, with a concert by Michael Feinstein and Linda Eder.

title: Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre
text: Located in Cobb County near Vinings, the venue is owned and operated by the Cobb- Marietta Coliseum& Exhibit Hall Authority, and took over two years to build.

title: Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre
text: The naming rights for the facility were acquired for$ 20 million by Cobb Energy Management Corp. Real estate developer John A. Williams' personal donation of$ 10 million led to the theater itself being named in his honor.

title: Limbo (dance)
text: Limbo is a popular dance contest, based on traditions that originated on the island of Trinidad. The aim is to pass forwards under a low bar without falling or dislodging the bar.

title: Limbo (dance)

title: Limbo (dance)
text: It was popularized in the 1950s by dance pioneer Julia Edwards( known as the First Lady of Limbo) and her company which appeared in several films, in particular" Fire Down Below"( 1957), and toured widely in the Caribbean, Europe, North America, South America, Asia, and Africa in the 1960s and later.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: K. Raghavendra Rao( born Kovelamudi Raghavendra Rao on 23 May 1942) is an Indian film director, producer, screenwriter and choreographer, known for his works predominantly in Telugu cinema and a few Hindi and Kannada films.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: He has garnered eight state Nandi Awards, the IIFA Award, the SIIMA Award, five Filmfare Awards South and two Cine MAA Awards.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: In a film career spanning more than five decades, Rao has directed more than a hundred feature films, of which around ninety were box office hits, across multiple genres such as romantic comedy, fantasy, melodrama, action thriller, biographical and romance films.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao received the state Nandi Award for Best Director for his works such as" Bobbili Brahmanna"( 1984), and" Pelli Sandadi"( 1996).

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: He garnered the Filmfare Award for Best Director – Telugu for the drama film" Prema Lekhalu"( 1977), the super natural fantasy film," Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari"( 1990), and the romance film" Allari Priyudu"( 1993).

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao is known for his works in hagiographical films such as" Annamayya"( 1997), which won two National Film Awards, and was also showcased at the 1998 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Rao also received the Nandi Award for Best Direction, the Filmfare Award for Best Direction for his work in the film.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: His other hagiographic works such as" Sri Manjunatha"( 2001)," Sri Ramadasu"( 2006)," Shirdi Sai"( 2012) and" Om Namo Venkatesaya"( 2017), received several state honors.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: His mainstream works such as the 1987 Social problem film" Agni Putrudu", and the 1988 action thriller" Aakhari Poratam", were screened at the 11th and 12th International Film Festival of India respectively in the mainstream section.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: In 1992, he directed the melodrama" Gharana Mogudu", premiered at the 1993 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section, which became the first Telugu film to gross over 10 crore at the box office.

title: K. Raghavendra Rao
text: Next, he directed the instant hit" Allari Priyudu", which was also premiered at the 1994 International Film Festival of India in the mainstream section.

title: Dharm Adhikari

text: Vedantam Raghavaiah (June 8, 1919 – 1971) was an Indian film choreographer, method actor, Kuchipudi exponent, musician, director and producer known for his works in Telugu cinema, Telugu theatre, and Tamil cinema.

title: Vedantam Raghavaiah
text: Raghavaiah was an accomplished Kuchipudi dancer, who was awarded “Bharata Kala Prapurna” in dance by the Andhra Pradesh government.

title: Vedantam Raghavaiah
text: Raghavaiah served in the committee of the First General Council of the "Andhra Pradesh Sangeeth Nataka Academy" that represented Dance and was also nominated in 1964 as the President of the "National Dance Festival".

title: Vedantam Raghavaiah
text: Noted dancer, Bhagavathula Yagna Narayana Sarma, Sangeet Natak Akademi winner was trained under Raghavaiah's Fellowship.

title: Vedantam Raghavaiah

title: Tom Shadyac

title: The Actors
text: The Actors is a 2003 film written and directed by Conor McPherson and starring Dylan Moran and Michael Caine. In supporting roles are Michael Gambon, Miranda Richardson and Lena Headey.

title: The Actors
text: " The Actors" is a contemporary comedy set in Dublin. It follows the exploits of two mediocre stage actors as they devise a plan to con a retired gangster out of £ 50,000.

title: The Actors
text: The gangster owes the money to a third party, whom he has never met. The actors take advantage of this fact by impersonating this' unidentified' third party, and claiming the debt as their own.

title: The Actors
text: To pull it off they enlist Moran's eerily intelligent nine- year- old niece, who restructures the plan each time something goes wrong.

title: The Actors
text: The two protagonists are acting in a version of Shakespeare's" Richard III" in which everyone dresses in Nazi uniform, a sly nod to Ian McKellen's production.

title: The Actors
text: The film is centred on the Olympia Theatre, and it is noteworthy for featuring the famous glass awning over the entrance which has since been destroyed in a traffic accident.

title: The Actors
text: The glass awning has since been rebuilt to its full former glory.

title: Van Morrison
text: Sir George Ivan "Van" Morrison (born 31 August 1945) is a Northern Irish singer- songwriter, instrumentalist and record producer.

title: Van Morrison
text: His professional career began as a teenager in the late 1950s playing a variety of instruments including guitar, harmonica, keyboards and saxophone for various Irish showbands, covering the popular hits of that time.

title: Van Morrison
text: Van Morrison rose to prominence in the mid-1960s as the lead singer of the Northern Irish R&B band Them, with whom he recorded the garage band classic "Gloria".

title: Van Morrison
text: His solo career began under the pop-hit oriented guidance of Bert Berns with the release of the hit single "Brown Eyed Girl" in 1967.

title: Van Morrison
text: After Berns's death, Warner Bros. Records bought out his contract and allowed him three sessions to record "Astral Weeks" (1968).

title: Van Morrison
text: Though this album gradually garnered high praise, it was initially a poor seller. Van Morrison has a reputation for being at once stubborn, idiosyncratic, and sublime.

title: Van Morrison
text: His live performances at their best are seen as transcendental and inspired; while many of his recordings, such as the studio albums "Astral Weeks" and "Moondance", and the live album " It's Too Late to Stop Now", are acclaimed.

title: Van Morrison
text: "Moondance" (1970) established Morrison as a major artist, and he built on his reputation throughout the 1970s with a series of acclaimed albums and live performances.

title: Van Morrison
text: He continues to record and tour, producing albums and live performances that sell well and are generally warmly received, sometimes collaborating with other artists, such as Georgie Fame and The Chieftains.

title: Van Morrison
text: Much of Morrison's music is structured around the conventions of soul music and R&B, such as the popular singles " Brown Eyed GirlJackie Wilson Said (I'm in Heaven When You Smile)Domino" and "Wild Night".

title: Van Morrison
text: An equal part of his catalogue consists of lengthy, loosely connected, spiritually inspired musical journeys that show the influence of Celtic tradition, jazz and stream-of-consciousness narrative, such as the album "Astral Weeks" and the lesser known "Veedon Fleece" and "Common One".

title: Van Morrison
text: The two strains together are sometimes referred to as "Celtic soul".

title: Van Morrison
text: He has received two Grammy Awards, the 1994 Brit Award for Outstanding Contribution to Music, the 2017 Americana Music Lifetime Achievement Award for Songwriting and has been inducted into both the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

title: Van Morrison
text: In 2016, he was knighted for services to the music industry and to tourism in Northern Ireland. He is known by the nickname Van the Man to his fans.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God? " first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is? " illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God? " was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is? " series include What is Love? , What is Death? , What is Beautiful? , What is Funny? , What is Right?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: , What is Peace? , What is Money? , What is Dreaming? , What is a Friend? , What is True? , What is a Family? , What is a Feeling?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " The series is now also translated into 15 languages. Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also. He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " programs. Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha. "

title: Theodred II (Bishop of Elmham)
text: Theodred II was a medieval Bishop of Elmham. The date of Theodred's consecration unknown, but the date of his death was sometime between 995 and 997.

title: O Valencia!
text: " O Valencia! " is the fifth single by the indie rock band The Decemberists, and the first released from their fourth studio album," The Crane Wife".

title: O Valencia!
text: The music was written by The Decemberists and the lyrics by Colin Meloy. It tells a story of two star- crossed lovers.

title: O Valencia!
text: The singer falls in love with a person who belongs to an opposing gang.

title: O Valencia!
text: At the end of the song, the singer's lover jumps in to defend the singer, who is confronting his lover's brother( the singer's" sworn enemy") and is killed by the bullet intended for the singer.

title: Billy Milano

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: The Da Vinci Code is a 2006 American mystery thriller film, directed by Ron Howard and written by Akiva Goldsman, based on Dan Brown's 2003 best- selling novel of the same name.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: The first in the" Robert Langdon" film series, the film stars Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Sir Ian McKellen, Alfred Molina, Jürgen Prochnow, Jean Reno and Paul Bettany.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: In the movie, Robert Langdon, a professor of religious symbology from Harvard University, is the prime suspect in the grisly and unusual murder of Louvre curator Jacques Saunière.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: In the body, the police find a disconcerting cipher and start an investigation.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: A noted British Grail historian named Sir Leigh Teabing tells them that the actual Holy Grail is explicitly encoded in Leonardo da Vinci's wall painting," The Last Supper".

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: Also searching for the Grail is a secret cabal within Opus Dei, an actual prelature of the Holy See, who wish to keep the true Grail a secret to prevent the destruction of Christianity.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: The film, like the book, was considered controversial.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: It was met with especially harsh criticism by the Catholic Church for the accusation that it is behind a two- thousand- year- old cover- up concerning what the Holy Grail really is and the concept that Jesus Christ and Mary Magdalene were married and that the union produced a daughter, as well as its treatment of the organizations Priory of Sion and Opus Dei.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: Many members urged the laity to boycott the film. In the book, Dan Brown states that the Priory of Sion and" all descriptions of artwork, architecture, documents and secret rituals in this novel are accurate.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: " The film grossed$ 224 million in its worldwide opening weekend and a total of$ 758 million worldwide, becoming the second- highest- grossing film of 2006.

title: The Da Vinci Code (film)
text: The film received generally negative reviews from critics. It was followed by two sequels," Angels& Demons"( 2009) and" Inferno"( 2016).

title: The Da Vinci Code WebQuests
text: The Da Vinci Code" WebQuests( also called The Da Vinci Code" Challenges) are a series of web- based puzzles related to the bestselling 2003 novel" The Da Vinci Code", as well as the 2006 film.

title: The Da Vinci Code WebQuests
text: There have been several web quests, none of which directly related to any other.

title: The Da Vinci Code WebQuests
text: Probably the most well known is the game run by Google, though it was ultimately met with much more public criticism than the other various games.

title: The Norman Rockwell Code
text: The Norman Rockwell Code is a 2006 parody of the widely popular movie," The Da Vinci Code". The plot is ridiculously exaggerated in an attempt to mock the" Da Vinci Code".

title: The Norman Rockwell Code
text: The movie was listed on the June 2, 2006 issue of" Entertainment Weekly' s The Must List. "

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: Angels& Demons is a 2009 American mystery thriller film directed by Ron Howard and written by Akiva Goldsman and David Koepp, based on Dan Brown's novel of the same title.

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: It is the sequel to the 2006 film" The Da Vinci Code", also directed by Howard, and the second installment in the" Robert Langdon" film series.

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: However, the novel version was published first and acts as a prequel to" The Da Vinci Code" novel. Filming took place in Rome, Italy, and the Sony Pictures Studios in Culver City, California.

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: Tom Hanks reprises his role as Professor Robert Langdon, while Ayelet Zurer stars as Dr. Vittoria Vetra, a CERN scientist joining Langdon in the quest to recover a missing vial of antimatter from a mysterious Illuminati terrorist.

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: Producer Brian Grazer, composer Hans Zimmer and screenwriter Akiva Goldsman also return, with David Koepp coming on board to help the latter.

title: Angels & Demons (film)
text: The film grossed$ 485 million worldwide and received mixed reviews from critics. A sequel, titled" Inferno", was released on October 28, 2016.

title: List of The Da Vinci Code characters
text: This is a list of fictional characters from Dan Brown's" The Da Vinci Code" and the 2006 film based on it.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: Inferno is a 2016 American mystery action thriller film directed by Ron Howard and written by David Koepp, loosely based on the 2013 novel of the same name by Dan Brown.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film is the sequel to" The Da Vinci Code"( 2006) and" Angels& Demons"( 2009), and is the third and final installment in the" Robert Langdon" film series.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: It stars Tom Hanks, reprising his role as Robert Langdon, alongside Felicity Jones, Omar Sy, Sidse Babett Knudsen, Ben Foster, and Irrfan Khan.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: Filming began on April 27, 2015, in Venice, Italy, and wrapped on July 21, 2015, in Budapest.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film premiered in Florence on October 9, 2016, and was released in the United States on October 28, 2016, ten years after release of" The Da Vinci Code", in 2D and IMAX formats.

title: Inferno (2016 film)
text: The film received generally negative reviews from critics, but grossed$ 220 million against a production budget of$ 75 million.

title: Lesser Slave Lake Provincial Park
text: Lesser Slave Lake Provincial Park is a provincial park and birdwatching area located in north- central Alberta, Canada.

title: Lesser Slave Lake Provincial Park
text: The park is located on the north- eastern shore of the Lesser Slave Lake( while Hilliard's Bay Provincial Park," Lesser Slave Lake Wildland" and" Grouard Trail Park Reserve" stand on the north- western shore), 12 km north from the town of Slave Lake on Highway 88.

title: South Heart River
text: The South Heart River is a river of Alberta. It empties into Lesser Slave Lake and is the largest river flowing into it.

title: Lesser Slave Lake
text: Lesser Slave Lake is located in central Alberta, Canada, northwest of Edmonton.

title: Lesser Slave Lake
text: It is the second largest lake entirely within Alberta boundaries( and the largest easily accessible by vehicle), covering and measuring over long and at its widest point.

title: Lesser Slave Lake
text: Lesser Slave Lake averages in depth and is at its deepest. It drains eastwards into the Athabasca River by way of the Lesser Slave River.

title: Lesser Slave Lake
text: The town of Slave Lake is located at the eastern tip of the lake, around the outflow of Lesser Slave River.

title: Medeweger See
text: Medeweger See is a lake in Mecklenburg- Vorpommern, Germany. At an elevation of 39.4 m, it s surface area is 0.95 km2.

title: Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124
text: The Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124 is a municipal district in north- central Alberta, Canada. Its municipal office is located in the Town of Slave Lake.

title: Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124
text: Located in Census Division 17, the municipal district takes its name from Lesser Slave River, which drains Lesser Slave Lake into the Athabasca River.

title: Slave Lake
text: Slave Lake is a small town in northern Alberta, Canada about 255 km( 124.3 mi) northwest of Edmonton and a similar distance southwest of Fort McMurray.

title: Slave Lake
text: It is located on the southeast shore of Lesser Slave Lake, at the junction of Highway 2 and Highway 88, in the Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124.

title: Slave Lake
text: Slave Lake serves as a local centre for the area. The administrative office for the Sawridge First Nation reserve is also located in the town.

title: Daisy Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: Daisy Lake is a lake in the Arctic Ocean and Great Slave Lake drainage basins in South Slave Region, Northwest Territories, Canada.

title: Daisy Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: The lake is about long and wide, lies at an elevation of, and is located about southeast of the settlement of Fort Reliance on McLeod Bay, the large easternmost bay of Great Slave Lake.

title: Daisy Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: It is also just southeast of the McDonald Fault.

title: Daisy Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: The primary inflow is an unnamed creek at the northeast, and the primary outflow is an unnamed creek at the southeast that empties into Dion Lake, whose waters in turn flow via Robert Lake and the Snowdrift River to Great Slave Lake at the community of Lutselk'e.

title: McArthur Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: McArthur Lake, formerly Clowey Lake, is a lake in the Northwest Territories, Canada. It is on the Taltson River to the east of Great Slave Lake, and is just south of the tree line.

title: McArthur Lake (Northwest Territories)
text: In the past it may have been a center for canoe building.

title: Marten Beach
text: Marten Beach is a hamlet in northern Alberta, Canada within the Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124.

title: Marten Beach
text: It is located on the northeast shore of Lesser Slave Lake, west of Highway 88. It is approximately north of the Town of Slave Lake and northwest of the City of Edmonton.

title: Marten Beach
text: Marten Beach is adjacent to Lesser Slave Lake Provincial Park, Carlver Creek to the north and Marten Creek to the south.

title: Slave Lake Airport

title: Boeing Condor
text: The Boeing Condor is a high- tech test bed aerial reconnaissance unmanned aerial vehicle. It has a wingspan of over 200 feet.

title: Boeing Condor
text: Carbon- fibre composite materials make up the bulk of the Condor's fuselage and wings.

title: Boeing Condor
text: Although the Condor has a relatively low radar cross-section and infrared signature, it is not unobservable making it too vulnerable for use in military operations.

title: Boeing Condor
text: The Condor is completely robotic, with an onboard computer to communicate with the computers on the ground via satellite to control all facets of the Condor's missions.

title: Boeing Condor
text: The Condor's frame is made of mainly Carbon- fiber- reinforced polymer composite, as it gives off very low radar and heat signatures.

title: Boeing Condor
text: In 1989, the Condor set the world piston- powered aircraft altitude record of and was the first aircraft to fly a fully automated flight from takeoff to landing and also setting an unofficial endurance world record in 1988 by flying continuously for more than 50 hours; the flight was not ratified by the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale( FAI) and is therefore not considered an official record.

title: Boeing Condor
text: During its evaluations, the Condor logged over 300 flight hours, flying over Moses Lake, Washington.

title: The Legend of the Condor Heroes
text: It was first serialised between 1 January 1957 and 19 May 1959 in "Hong Kong Commercial Daily". Jin Yong revised the novel twice, first in the 1970s and later in the 2000s.

title: The Legend of the Condor Heroes
text: The English title is imprecise since neither species of the condor, the Andean condor and Californian condor, is native to China.

title: The Legend of the Condor Heroes

title: Miguel Littín
text: Miguel Ernesto Littin Cucumides (born 9 August 1942) is a Chilean film director, screenwriter, film producer and novelist.

title: Miguel Littín
text: He was born to a Palestinian father, Hernán Littin and a Greek mother, Cristina Cucumides.

title: Miguel Littín
text: Miguel Littin directed the most popular Chilean film of all time, "El Chacal de Nahueltoro" (1969) becoming a figure of the New Latin American Cinema.

title: Miguel Littín
text: Littin was exiled in México shortly after Augusto Pinochet came to power in a military coup, which ousted the democratically elected socialist president Salvador Allende, on September 11, 1973.

title: Miguel Littín
text: His 1973 film "The Promised Land" was entered into the Cannes Film Festival, New York film festival and the 8th Moscow International Film Festival.

title: Miguel Littín
text: In México he directed several films: Then he went to Nicaragua to make Alsino and the Condor, based on the novel "Alsino" by Pedro Prado.

title: Miguel Littín
text: In 1981 he was a member of the jury at the 12th Moscow International Film Festival.

title: Miguel Littín
text: After moving to Spain in 1984, Littin decided to enter Chile clandestinely to make a documentary that showed the condition of the country under the Pinochet regime.

title: Miguel Littín
text: It was made the subject of Nobel Laureate Gabriel Garcia Marquez's book .

title: Miguel Littín
text: He eventually returned to Chile where he continued to make films, among them "Tierra del Fuego", based on the adventures of explorer Julius Popper; and "Dawson, Isla 10", about a group of political prisoners sent to Dawson's Island during Pinochet's regime.

title: Miguel Littín
text: Littin was the mayor of his home town in the center valley, Palmilla in 1992-94 and re-elected for the period 1996-2000.

title: Miguel Littín
text: His films "Actas de Marusia" and "Alsino and the Condor" were nominated by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences for Best Film in a Foreign Language.

title: Miguel Littín
text: "Alsino and the Condor" won the Golden Prize at the 13th Moscow International Film Festival. His 2005 film "The Last Moon" was entered into the 27th Moscow International Film Festival.

title: George Lamb (politician)

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: The youngest son of Peniston Lamb, 1st Viscount Melbourne, and his wife Elizabeth, and the brother of William Lamb, 2nd Viscount Melbourne, Frederick Lamb, 3rd Viscount Melbourne, and Emily Lamb, Countess Cowper, he was educated at Eton College and Trinity College, Cambridge, where he graduated MA in 1805.

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: On 17 May 1809, he married Caroline Rosalie Adelaide St. Jules, the illegitimate daughter of William Cavendish, 5th Duke of Devonshire, by his mistress( and eventual second wife) Lady Elizabeth Foster.

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: In 1805 his brother William had married Caroline's cousin Lady Caroline Ponsonby, whose affair with the poet Lord Byron led her to describe him as" mad, bad, and dangerous to know".

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: The Lambs had no children and it was speculated that the marriage was never consummated.

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: He became a barrister at Lincoln's Inn, and was Member of Parliament for Westminster from March 1819 to March 1820, and for Dungarvan from 1822 until his death.

title: George Lamb (politician)

title: George Lamb (politician)
text: His comic opera" Whistle for it" was produced in 1807, and his adaptations of Timon of Athens in 1816. His most important work, a translation of the poems of Catullus, was published in 1821.

title: Solfilmen

title: Solfilmen
text: The Solfilmen was started in March 1963 in Black- and- White format and stopped broadcasting in Midsummer 1963. However, it restarted in January 1969 in color format.

title: Solfilmen
text: At first, it monitored sunrise and sunset times for Stockholm, Lund and Luleå. SVT stopped monitoring sunrise and sunset times for Luleå and started monitoring sunrise and sunset times for Kiruna.

title: Solfilmen
text: In 2008, SVT started to monitor sunrise and sunset times for Lycksele.

title: Uvanga
text: Uvanga(' I, me, mine') is a Canadian drama film, released in 2013. Written and directed by Marie- Hélène Cousineau and Madeline Ivalu, it was the second narrative feature film released by Arnait Video Productions.

title: Uvanga
text: The film stars Marianne Farley as Anna, a woman from Montreal who once had a relationship with Caleb, an Inuk man from Igloolik, Nunavut; after learning of Caleb's death, she takes their 14- year- old son Tomas( Lukasi Forrest) on a trip to Nunavut to learn more about his Inuit heritage.

title: Uvanga
text: Sarah( Ivalu), Caleb's mother and Tomas' grandmother, tries to keep the peace between Anna and Caleb's widow Sheba( Carol Kunnuk), while Tomas bonds with his half- brother Travis( Travis Kunnuk) and Anna begins to suspect that Sheba's new boyfriend Barrie( Peter- Henry Arnatsiaq) may know more about Caleb's death than he has admitted.

title: Uvanga
text: The film garnered three Jutra Award nominations at the 17th Jutra Awards, in the categories of Best Sound( Eric Ladouceur, Luc Mandeville and Lynne Trépanier), Best Editing( Glenn Berman) and Best Original Music( Alain Auger).

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Carnival of Souls is a 1962 American independent horror film written, produced, and directed by Herk Harvey, and starring Candace Hilligoss.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Its plot follows Mary Henry, a young woman whose life is disturbed after a car accident.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: She relocates to a new city, where she finds herself unable to assimilate with the locals, and becomes drawn to the pavilion of an abandoned carnival; director Harvey also appears in the film as a ghoulish stranger who stalks her throughout.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Filmed in Lawrence, Kansas and Salt Lake City, "Carnival of Souls" was shot on a budget of $33,000, and Harvey employed various guerrilla filmmaking techniques to finish the production.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: It was Harvey's only feature film, and did not gain widespread attention when originally released as a double feature with "The Devil's Messenger" in 1962.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: Set to an organ score by Gene Moore, the film has been contemporarily noted by critics and film scholars for its cinematography and foreboding atmosphere.

title: Carnival of Souls
text: The film has a large cult following and is occasionally screened at film and Halloween festivals, and has been cited as a wide-ranging influence on numerous filmmakers, including David Lynch, George A. Romero and even Argentine auteur Lucrecia Martel.

title: Carnival of Souls (1998 film)
text: Carnival of Souls( also billed as Wes Craven Presents' Carnival of Souls') is a 1998 American horror film, a remake of Herk Harvey's 1962 horror film of the same name, although it has very little in common with the story of the original.

title: Carnival of Souls (1998 film)
text: It stars Bobbie Phillips and comedian Larry Miller, and was directed by Adam Grossman and Ian Kessner. It was executive produced by Wes Craven.

title: Carnival of Souls: The Final Sessions
text: Carnival of Souls: The Final Sessions( also known as simply Carnival of Souls) is the seventeenth studio album by American rock band Kiss, released in 1997.

title: Carnival of Souls: The Final Sessions
text: It is the band's final album with lead guitarist Bruce Kulick, as well as their last album with drummer Eric Singer until 2009's" Sonic Boom".

title: Carnival of Souls: The Final Sessions
text: The album is a departure from the band's classic hard rock style, in favor of a dark and dense grunge- oriented sound. It is also the band's last album of their unmasking era.

title: Frankie Laine
text: Frankie Laine (born Francesco Paolo LoVecchio; March 30, 1913 – February 6, 2007) was an American singer, songwriter, and actor whose career spanned nearly 75 years, from his first concerts in 1930 with a marathon dance company to his final performance of "That's My Desire" in 2005.

title: Frankie Laine
text: Often billed as "America's Number One Song Stylist", his other nicknames include "Mr. RhythmOld Leather Lungs", and "Mr. Steel Tonsils".

title: Frankie Laine
text: His hits included "That's My DesireThat Lucky Old SunMule TrainJezebelHigh NoonI BelieveHey Joe! The Kid's Last FightCool WaterRawhide", and "Lord, You Gave Me a Mountain".

title: Frankie Laine
text: He sang well-known theme songs for many movie Western soundtracks, including , "Gunfight at the O.K. Corral", and "Blazing Saddles", although his recordings were not charted as a country & western.

title: Frankie Laine
text: Laine sang an eclectic variety of song styles and genres, stretching from big band crooning to pop, western-themed songs, gospel, rock, folk, jazz, and blues.

title: Frankie Laine
text: He did not sing the soundtrack song for "High Noon", which was sung by Tex Ritter, but his own version (with somewhat altered lyrics, omitting the name of the antagonist, Frank Miller) was the one that became a bigger hit, nor did he sing the theme to another show he is commonly associated with—"Champion the Wonder Horse" (sung by Mike Stewart)—but released his own, subsequently more popular, version.

title: Frankie Laine
text: Laine's enduring popularity was illustrated in June 2011, when a TV-advertised compilation called "Hits" reached No. 16 on the British chart.

title: Frankie Laine
text: The accomplishment was achieved nearly 60 years after his debut on the UK chart, 64 years after his first major U.S. hit and four years after his death.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born. This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live. If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947. This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth". It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Bahadur Shah Zafar or Bahadur Shah II (born as Mirza Abu Zafar Siraj-ud-din Muhammad) (24 October 1775 – 7 November 1862) was the last Mughal emperor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: He was the second son of and became the successor to his father, Akbar II, upon his death on 28 September 1837.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: He was a nominal Emperor, as the Mughal Empire existed in name only and his authority was limited only to the walled city of Old Delhi (Shahjahanbad).

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Following his involvement in the Indian Rebellion of 1857, the British exiled him to Rangoon in British-controlled Burma (now in Myanmar), after convicting him on several charges.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: Zafar's father, Akbar II had been imprisoned by the British and he was not his father's preferred choice as his successor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: One of Akbar Shah's queens, Mumtaz Begum, pressured him to declare her son, Mirza Jahangir, as his successor.

title: Bahadur Shah Zafar
text: However, The East India Company exiled Jahangir after he attacked their resident, in the Red Fort, paving the way for Zafar to assume the throne.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born. This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live. If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947. This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth". It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: Lamprocles
text: Lamprocles was Socrates' and Xanthippe's eldest son. His two brothers were Menexenus and Sophroniscus. Lamprocles was only a boy (μειράκιον "meirakion") at the time of Socrates' trial and death.

title: Lamprocles
text: According to Aristotle, Socrates' descendants as a whole turned out to be unremarkable "fools and dullards".

title: Place of origin
text: In Switzerland, the place of origin( literally" home place" or" citizen place") denotes where a Swiss citizen has their municipal citizenship.

title: Place of origin
text: It is not to be confused with the place of birth or place of residence, although two or all three of these locations may be identical depending on the person's circumstances.

title: Socrates
text: Socrates (– 399 BC) was a classical Greek (Athenian) philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy, and as being the first moral philosopher of the Western ethical tradition of thought.

title: Socrates
text: An enigmatic figure, he made no writings, and is known chiefly through the accounts of classical writers writing after his lifetime, particularly his students Plato and Xenophon.

title: Socrates
text: Other sources include the contemporaneous Antisthenes, Aristippus, and Aeschines of Sphettos.

title: Socrates
text: Aristophanes, a playwright, is the main contemporary author to have written plays mentioning Socrates during Socrates' lifetime, though a fragment of Ion of Chios' "Travel Journal" provides important information about Socrates' youth.

title: Socrates
text: Plato's dialogues are among the most comprehensive accounts of Socrates to survive from antiquity, from which Socrates has become renowned for his contributions to the fields of ethics and epistemology.

title: Socrates
text: It is this who lends his name to the concepts of Socratic irony and the Socratic method, or "elenchus.

title: Socrates
text: " However, questions remain regarding the distinction between the real-life Socrates and Plato's portrayal of Socrates in his dialogues.

title: Socrates
text: Socrates exerted a strong influence on philosophers in later antiquity and in the modern era.

title: Socrates
text: Depictions of Socrates in art, literature and popular culture have made him one of the most widely known figures in the Western philosophical tradition.

title: Sennedjem
text: The Ancient Egyptian artisan Sennedjem lived in Set Maat( translated as" The Place of Truth"), contemporary Deir el- Medina, on the west bank of the Nile, opposite Thebes, during the reigns of Seti I and Ramesses II.

title: Sennedjem
text: Sennedjem had the title" Servant in the Place of Truth". He was buried along with his wife, Iyneferti, and family in a tomb in the village necropolis.

title: Sennedjem
text: His tomb was discovered January 31, 1886. When Sennedjem's tomb was found, in it there was regular furniture from his home, including a stool and a bed, which he actually used when he was alive.

title: Sennedjem
text: His titles included Servant in the Place of Truth, meaning that he worked on the excavation and decoration of the nearby royal tombs.

text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God? " first published in 1989.

text: His best selling" What is? " illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God? " was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is? " series include What is Love? , What is Death? , What is Beautiful? , What is Funny? , What is Right?

text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also. He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " programs. Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Lee and Herring
text: Lee and Herring were a British standup comedy double act consisting of the comedians Stewart Lee and Richard Herring.

title: Lee and Herring
text: They were most famous for their work on television, most notably" Fist of Fun" and" This Morning with Richard Not Judy" but had been working together on stage and on radio since the late 1980s.

title: Lee and Herring
text: As with many double acts, Lee and Herring performed as contrasting personalities: one mature and duplicitous( Lee) and the other puerile and cheeky( Herring).

title: Lee and Herring
text: As with several other double acts, Lee and Herring had a certain irony to their style and constantly checked themselves and made reference to this.

title: Lee and Herring
text: The characters of Lee and Herring were parodies and exaggerations of their real life selves.

title: Lee and Herring
text: In 2011, Frank Skinner cited Lee and Herring as one of his favourite comedy double acts, alongside Laurel and Hardy, The Two Ronnies and Reeves and Mortimer.

title: Euna Lee
text: Euna Lee( Hangul: 리유나)( born 1972) is a Korean American journalist who has worked for Current TV since 2005.

title: Euna Lee
text: Lee and fellow journalist Laura Ling were detained in North Korea after they crossed into the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from the People's Republic of China without a visa.

title: Euna Lee
text: They were found guilty of illegal entry and sentenced to twelve years' hard labor in June 2009.

title: Euna Lee
text: The United States Government protested the sentences, and implemented diplomatic efforts in order to secure the release of both Lee and Ling.

title: Euna Lee
text: On 4 August 2009 Lee and Ling were pardoned by the North Korean government after a special humanitarian visit by former U.S. President Bill Clinton.

title: Euna Lee
text: Lee was born and raised in South Korea, and moved to the United States in order to attend Academy of Art University, where she received a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Film and Broadcasting.

title: Euna Lee
text: She graduated from the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism in 2012. She is married to actor Michael Saldate; they have a daughter, Hana.

title: Euna Lee
text: On 4 August 2009, former US President Bill Clinton visited North Korea in an attempt to free Lee and fellow journalist Laura Ling.

title: Euna Lee
text: The North Korean government pardoned both Lee and Ling after meeting with Clinton that day.

title: Euna Lee
text: Human rights activists in South Korea accused Lee and Ling of placing North Korean refugees in danger through their actions.

title: Euna Lee
text: In 2011, Lee and Ling received the McGill Medal for Journalistic Courage from the Grady College of Journalism and Mass Communication.

text: Harald Reinl( 8 July 1908 in Bad Ischl, Austria – 9 October 1986 in Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain) was an Austrian film director.

title: Harald Reinl
text: He is known for the films he made based on Edgar Wallace and Karl May books( see Karl May movies and Edgar Wallace movies) and also made mountain films, Heimatfilms, German war films and entries in such popular German film series as" Dr. MabuseJerry Cotton" and" Kommissar X".

title: Harald Reinl
text: Reinl began his career as an extra in the mountain films of Arnold Fanck. He worked as screenwriter on the film" Tiefland" directed by and starring Leni Riefenstahl.

title: Harald Reinl
text: Reinl's first movie as director was the mountain film" Mountain Crystal"( 1949). He was Oscar nominated for his documentary feature" Chariots of the Gods"( 1970).

text: By the 1970s, he had semi-retired to the Canary Islands. In 1986, in his Tenerife retirement home, he was stabbed to death by Daniela Maria Delis, his alcoholic wife and a former actress from Czechoslovakia.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Ashes and Diamonds( Polish: Popiół i diament) is a 1958 Polish drama film directed by Andrzej Wajda, based on the 1948 novel by Polish writer Jerzy Andrzejewski.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Starring Zbigniew Cybulski and Ewa Krzyżewska, it completed Wajda's war films trilogy, following" A Generation"( 1954) and" Kanal"( 1956).

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The action of" Ashes and Diamonds" takes place in 1945, shortly after World War II. The main protagonist of the film, former Home Army soldier Maciek Chełmicki, is acting in the anti-Communist underground.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Maciek receives an order to kill Szczuka, the local secretary of the Polish Workers' Party. Over time, Chełmicki increasingly doubts if his task is worth doing.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: " Ashes and Diamonds", although based on the novel which directly supported the postwar Communist system in Poland, was subtly modified in comparison with the source material.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Wajda sympathized with the soldiers of the Polish independence underground; thus, he devoted most of the attention to Chełmicki.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: During the three- month development of" Ashes and Diamonds", the director made drastic changes to the baseline scenario, thanks to his assistant director Janusz Morgenstern, as well as Cybulski, who played the leading role.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The film received permission from the authorities to be distributed only through Andrzejewski's intercession.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: The film did not receive permission to be screened at the main competition at the Cannes Film Festival.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: However," Ashes and Diamonds" appeared at the Venice Film Festival, where it won the FIPRESCI award.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: At first," Ashes and Diamonds" met positive critical reception, both in Poland and worldwide.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: However, after the Revolutions of 1989, it was criticized for falsifying the collective memory of Polish partisans.

title: Ashes and Diamonds (film)
text: Nevertheless, the film maintained the reputation of one of the most famous Polish motion pictures in history.

title: St. Mary High School (Rutherford, New Jersey)
text: St. Mary High School is a four- year Roman Catholic high school located in Rutherford, in Bergen County, New Jersey, United States, operating under the auspices of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark.

title: St. Mary High School (Rutherford, New Jersey)

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God? " first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is? " illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God? " was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is? " series include What is Love? , What is Death? , What is Beautiful? , What is Funny? , What is Right?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: , What is Peace? , What is Money? , What is Dreaming? , What is a Friend? , What is True? , What is a Family? , What is a Feeling?

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " The series is now also translated into 15 languages. Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also. He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!

title: Etan Boritzer
text: " programs. Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer

title: Bernard Nathanson
text: Bernard N. Nathanson (July 31, 1926 – February 21, 2011) was an American medical doctor and co-founder in 1969 of the National Association for the Repeal of Abortion Laws — NARAL — later renamed National Abortion Rights Action League.

title: Bernard Nathanson
text: He was also the former director of New York City's Center for Reproductive and Sexual Health, but later became a pro-life activist.

title: Bernard Nathanson

title: Nick Gillespie
text: Nicholas John Gillespie( born August 7, 1963) is an American libertarian journalist who was editor- in- chief of" Reason" magazine from 2000 to 2008 and editor- in- chief of Reason.com and Reason TV from 2008 to 2017.

title: Nick Gillespie
text: Gillespie originally joined Reason's staff in 1993 as an assistant editor and ascended to the top slot in 2000. He is currently an editor- at- large at" Reason".

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: Eclipse of Reason is a 1987 anti-abortion documentary video directed, filmed, and narrated by Bernard Nathanson, with an introduction by Charlton Heston.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: " Eclipse of Reason" is a follow up to Nathanson ’s first film" The Silent Scream". The film is perhaps most known for its controversial depiction of a dilation and evacuation( D&E) abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: The subject matter of this film focuses more on the moral implications of abortion. It served as Nathanson ’s call to the women of the world to end the practice of abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: This film, as well as" The Silent Scream", was instrumental in the Right to Life Committee's garnering the attention of the United States public regarding the issue of abortion.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: " Eclipse of Reason" represented the argument that the fetus is human, and therefore abortion is murder.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: The film also serves to combat critics to" The Silent Scream" who argue that, although Nathanson claimed the film relied only on imagery and not pejorative speech, the film was heavily reliant on upon the language of the narrator.

title: Eclipse of Reason
text: Therefore," Eclipse of Reason" delivers the same message that abortion is murder, with similar imagery as its predecessor" The Silent Scream"; however, to avoid the previous appropriation of language over imagery" Eclipse of Reason" asks it viewers to consider reason rather than using emotionally charged narration.

title: Emir Hadžihafizbegović
text: Emir Hadžihafizbegović( born 20 August 1961) is a Bosnian theater, film and television actor and part- time politician.

title: Emir Hadžihafizbegović
text: He has appeared in over 50 films such as" When Father Was Away on Business"( 1985)," Remake"( 2003)," Fuse"( 2003)," Days and Hours"( 2004)," The Border Post"( 2006)," Grbavica"( 2006)," Armin"( 2007)," Death of a Man in the Balkans"( 2012) and" These Are the Rules"( 2014).

title: Emir Hadžihafizbegović
text: He is a member of Bosniak nationalist Party of Democratic Action( SDA). Hadžihafizbegović lives and works in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: Emir Hadžihafizbegović
text: He also spent almost the entirety of the Bosnian War in besieged Sarajevo as part of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina( ARBiH) and Croatian Defence Council( HVO).

title: Emir Hadžihafizbegović
text: He served as minister of culture and sports of Sarajevo Canton from 2006 to 2011, and since 5 October 2019, has been part of the Presidency of SDA.

title: Emir Kusturica
text: Emir Kusturica( born 24 November 1954) is a Serbian filmmaker, actor and musician. He also has French citizenship.

title: Emir Kusturica
text: He has been recognized for several internationally acclaimed feature films, as well as his projects in town- building.

title: Emir Kusturica
text: He has competed at the Cannes Film Festival on five occasions and won the Palme d' Or twice( for" When Father Was Away on Business" and" Underground"), as well as the Best Director prize for" Time of the Gypsies".

title: Emir Kusturica
text: Kusturica has also won a Silver Bear at the Berlin Film Festival for" Arizona Dream" and a Silver Lion at the Venice Film Festival for" Black Cat, White Cat".

title: Emir Kusturica
text: In addition he was also named Commander of the French Ordre des Arts et des Lettres.

title: Emir Kusturica
text: Since the mid-2000s, Kusturica's primary residence has been in Drvengrad, a town built for his film" Life Is a Miracle", in the Mokra Gora region of Serbia.

title: Emir Kusturica
text: He had portions of the historic village reconstructed for the film. He has been a member of the Academy of Sciences and Arts of the Republika Srpska since 9 November 2011.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: Underground(/" Podzemlje"), is a 1995 comedy- drama film directed by Emir Kusturica, with a screenplay co-written by the director and Dušan Kovačević.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: It is also known by the subtitle" Once Upon a Time There Was One Country", which was the title of the 5- hour mini-series( the long cut of the movie) shown on Serbian RTS television.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: The film uses the epic story of two friends to portray a Yugoslav history from the beginning of World War II until the beginning of Yugoslav Wars.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: The film was an international co-production with companies from Yugoslavia( Serbia), France, Germany, Czech Republic and Hungary.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: The theatrical version is 163 minutes long. In interviews, Kusturica stated that his original version ran for over 320 minutes, and that he was forced to cut it by co-producers.

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: " Underground" won the Palme d' Or at the 1995 Cannes Film Festival. It was Kusturica's second such award after" When Father Was Away on Business"( 1985).

title: Underground (1995 film)
text: It went on to win other honours.

title: When Father Was Away on Business
text: When Father Was Away on Business (Отац на службеном путу) is a 1985 Yugoslav film by director Emir Kusturica. The screenplay was written by the Bosnian dramatist Abdulah Sidran.

title: When Father Was Away on Business
text: Its subtitle is "A Historical Love Film" and it was produced by Centar Film and Forum, production companies based in Sarajevo.

title: When Father Was Away on Business
text: Set in post-World War II Yugoslavia during the Informbiro period, the film tells the story from the perspective of a boy, Malik, whose father Meša (Miki Manojlović) was sent to a labour camp.

title: When Father Was Away on Business
text: "When Father Was Away on Business" won the Palme d'Or at the 1985 Cannes Film Festival and was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

title: Vilko Filač

title: David Ji
text: David Longfen Ji is an American businessman who co-founded Apex Digital, an electronics manufacturer.

title: David Ji
text: In 2004, he was arrested in China following a dispute with Sichuan Changhong Electric, a supplier owned by the city of Mianyang and the province of Sichuan.

title: David Ji
text: Changhong accused him of defrauding them through bad checks. Ji was taken, according to an account by his lawyer, to the senior management and told, "I decide whether you live or die.

title: David Ji
text: " He has been held in China without charges. Ji's case highlighted an "implicit racism" in dealings with American businessmen.

title: David Ji
text: As a U.S. citizen he was not granted the same treatment by authorities as non-ethnically Chinese businessmen sharing the same nationality.

title: James Robertson (psychoanalyst)

title: John Agoglia
text: John Joseph Agoglia (September 24, 1937 – March 14, 2014) was an American television executive noted for his work at NBC from 1980 to 1998, including a tenure as President of NBC Enterprises.

title: John Agoglia
text: He was considered one of the network's top negotiators, often heading complicated negotiations between NBC and producers, actors and television studios.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia was instrumental in the decision to replace Johnny Carson, the departing host of "The Tonight Show", with Jay Leno in 1992.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia was born in Brooklyn, New York. His career began at Barclays Bank, before switching to the television industry.

title: John Agoglia
text: He worked as an executive at CBS for sixteen years before joining rival NBC in 1980. Agoglia moved to southern California permanently when he took the position at NBC.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia worked directly under a string of well-known Presidents of NBC Entertainment and other executives, including Brandon Tartikoff, Warren Littlefield and Don Ohlmeyer.

title: John Agoglia
text: He earned a reputation as one of the network's toughest dealmakers. Agoglia led the often drawn-out negotiations with outside television studios and on-air talent.

title: John Agoglia
text: For example, Agoglia hammered out a deal with Paramount Studios for the renewal of "Cheers".

title: John Agoglia
text: He also negotiated the agreement to retain three cast members of Seinfeld - Jason Alexander, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, and Michael Richards - when each actor was demanding one million dollars per episode at the peak of the show's popularity.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia played a significant role in the decision by NBC to name Jay Leno as the host of "The Tonight Show" over David Letterman in 1992.

title: John Agoglia
text: The move sparked controversy, as Letterman jumped to CBS after Leno's appointment.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia's role in choosing Leno as Johnny Carson's successor was noted in the 1994 book, "The Late Shift", by "New York Times" journalist, Bill Carter.

title: John Agoglia
text: An HBO film adaptation of the book, "The Late Shift", aired in 1996. Agoglia was portrayed by actor Reni Santoni in the film.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia led a multi-network 1993 boycott of the Emmy Awards, following a decision by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences to air the awards exclusively on ABC.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Emmys had previously broadcast on the television networks on a rotating basis.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia denounced the exclusivity agreement between ABC and the Emmys as "bizarre at best" and retaliated by boycott all Academy events, including the Primetime Emmy Awards.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Academy and the Emmys, under pressure from Agoglia's boycott, eventually relented and cancelled the deal with ABC.

title: John Agoglia
text: The Emmys returned to the previous agreement, in which the award show was broadcast on each of the four broadcast networks on a rotating basic each year.

title: John Agoglia
text: Agoglia rejoined the executive committee of the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences in 1994 after the deal with ABC was ended.

title: John Agoglia
text: On June 17, 1997, Agoglia announced his decision to retire from NBC. He left NBC in 1998 after eighteen years with the network.

title: John Agoglia
text: During his retirement Agoglia launched a Media Consulting firm; served as President of the Board of LAX Airport Commission; Served on board of directors of KCET Los Angeles; and was board chairman of the Los Angeles Universal Preschool Program.

title: John Agoglia
text: John Agoglia died on March 14, 2014, at the age of 76 following a three-year illness with cancer.

title: John Agoglia
text: He was survived by his sons, Anthony and John Steven, three grandchildren, and his brother, Thomas Agoglia. His wife, Joanne Agoglia, died in 2010.
